description:
Shorefield is a characterful eco-house in Bruichladdich on the Isle of Islay, Scotland, sleeping 6 guests in 3 bedrooms. This well-insulated property runs on its own wind and solar power, making it perfect for eco-conscious travelers and nature enthusiasts visiting the Scottish Islands.

The house is owned by an elderly couple who are passionate bird lovers, and their enthusiasm is reflected throughout the property. The garden includes private woodland, ponds, and bird reserves created by the owners, offering exceptional opportunities for bird watching and nature observation. The property retains its quaint, quirky charm with original paintings, maps, antiques, books, and stories throughout - perfect for those seeking character over modern minimalism.

The accommodation features a large kitchen table for 6, separate dining room also seating 6, wood-burning stove, and selection of books and games. Wifi is available throughout. The property has 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Please note there is no dishwasher, but washing machine and dryer are provided. Bruichladdich Distillery is a 10-minute walk along the coastal cycle path, while swimming beaches are easily accessible. Port Charlotte's restaurants, pubs, and shops are 5 minutes by car or 45 minutes via the scenic cycle path. Dogs welcome at £15 per stay. Ideal for nature lovers, bird watchers, and visitors seeking an authentic, eco-friendly Isle of Islay experience.

ownerContext: Shorefield is the owners' own family home. They are well-travelled bird watchers and painters. Bird books, binoculars, sketches, watercolours, and furniture from their travels to Africa and Asia are throughout the house. The woodland, ponds, and bird reserves behind the house were created by the owners over decades. This personal history is what guests love most about Shorefield - it has a story and a soul.

reviewHighlights.quote: Shorefield is like a big hug. It feels like home, not a rental. The personal touches and character throughout made our stay so special.
The house has a story - you can feel the love and care the owners have put into it. The bird reserves and woodland are extraordinary.
We loved the quirkiness and all the beautiful paintings and artifacts. This is not a soulless rental - it's a real home full of personality.
The kids spent hours exploring the woodland and ponds. We adults loved the cosy wood burner and peaceful atmosphere. Perfect retreat.
Eco-friendly without compromising comfort. The wind and solar power, well-insulated design, and thoughtful sustainability impressed us.
